body: @dependabot rebase
Looks like io.swagger.core.v3:swagger-core is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

While there is nothing wrong with the code, I don't think we'll merge it into the framework. Mainly because I think the docs created are suitable to provide a documentation blueprint, but in the general case, not enough to be presented to the end-user.

This is opinionated of course.

I guess if we really were to introduce a new service _DocumentationService_, I'd rather reuse the ascii-doc site-index generator and let some tooling do the conversion to html.
For now, let's keep this PR open for further discussion and ideas.
Thanks for this contribution, @myroch .  Andi and I discussed it a bit more, actually we think we will bring this in, we think it's a nice idea.  So, thanks!  @andi-huber  - can you do the honours?

Hallo @andi-huber @danhaywood
Thank you very much for the merging. As I said, I wasn't able to test it in the newest version, have you it tried then?
Andi, it looks actually very good in our project, we present it to the end-user. I'm curious what is wrong on your side, maybe lack of the description in the annotations? Otherwise we can still fix it.
Anyway thanks guys, my code is mainly based on @yourfrienddhruv 's work, so he should be honored instead.
Regards,
m.

I'll see that I add this new menu bar entry to our demo app. I might do some tiny refactoring.

And as I said I like the idea, but don't particularly like the programmatic HTML creation code. But as discussed with Dan, we can always improve that later if required.
fixed in master instead

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
With this PR there are some interesting observations regarding the metamodel, maybe subject to future work. In the meantime, we ended up with a more straight forward solution.

@andi-huber  ... for the legacy builds, though, can we revert the namespace back to whatever it used to be?

@danhaywood - I believe what I'm doing here is non invasive. Meaning it should not affect existing code ...

old
```
xmlns:bs3="https://causeway.apache.org/applib/layout/grid/bootstrap3"
```

new
```
xmlns:bs="https://causeway.apache.org/applib/layout/grid/bootstrap3"
```

Agreed? (I might be wrong.)
I like that one! Also useful for actions that are only exposed via RO, like in `@DomainService(nature=REST)`
